name: TheAtlantic
text: For the first time ever, a woman, Maya Gabeira, surfed a taller wave than her male counterpart, breaking a world record in the process. So why do some people think the World Surf League is burying that news? @maggiejmertens reports: https://t.co/kpUGYfLboD

name: TheAtlantic
text: One progressive group's strategy to help Biden appeal to young voters: promote him as part of a group of "Democratic Avengers," @olgakhazan reports: https://t.co/4RyPchViXp

name: TheAtlantic
text: Readers respond to our July/August 2020 cover story and more: https://t.co/IMyGI0hX1O

name: TheAtlantic
text: Revisit a poem from yesteryear, read a short story, tour America from your couch, and other suggestions for the weekend. The latest Atlantic Daily, by @mimbsy: https://t.co/cIrVjg3K5F

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @Saahil_Desai: "An Instagram post tagged #nofilter makes an implicit claim against artifice: This is how it really looked. And yet, there is no such thing as an unfiltered image, just differently filtered ones." This by @ibogost is so interesting https://t.co/s5JrX5vPGb

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @krisguillaume: Prison literature explores how to build a more just society, what purpose the police serve, and whether prisons should exist. Books by Malcolm X, Austin Reed, Susan Burton, and more in my briefing for @TheAtlantic https://t.co/1TrgVXgzgz

name: TheAtlantic
text: "In exchange for access and information, Woodward offers Washington power holders the opportunity to disparage their rivals and aggrandize themselves," @davidfrum writes: https://t.co/aapWOVkkx3

name: TheAtlantic
text: When will rapid coronavirus testing be here? And is it the near-term solution we've hoped for? Listen to @alexismadrigal on the podcast "Social Distance": https://t.co/jsoyjCnyN3 https://t.co/MzhnQvT1xs

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: Nazaré, the break where Gabeira set the record, is like Portugal’s answer to Jaws on Maui. When Jaws goes off, it breaks at 60+ feet. Gabeira surfed a 75-foot wave (!) at Nazaré. Both are terrifying, awesome. https://t.co/qwK2Ik01Rc

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @davidfrum: "As he commenced discussions on a second [Trump] book Woodward evidently realized that he was dealing with a chump, a sucker, a patsy, a galoot—the schmendrick of all schmendricks." Latest in @theAtlantic https://t.co/n9YI9GFotu

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @SStossel: "Trump did not understand that you do not reason with Woodward. You haggle with him, then you work him." https://t.co/qxBJ3KHiet

name: TheAtlantic
text: New reports warn that Russian hackers are attempting to interfere with the 2020 election. In June, @FranklinFoer examined why Russia’s goal was never to elect Donald Trump, but to dismantle American democracy: https://t.co/1arn6hyJNf
